Base:InitialProperties.Base:InitialProperty:
"THE VELVET TOUCH\
\
Hand-Book for Glovers\
\
CONTENTS\
\
2. Introduction\
3. Material\
4. Fit\
5. Measures of Proficiency\
6. Novice\
7. Junior Apprentice\
8. Senior Apprentice\
9. Fellowcraft\
10. Journeyman\
11. Artisan\
12. Senior Artisan\
13. Master\
14. Master Adept\
15. Grand Master\
16. Updates"

"INTRODUCTION\
\
When man first picked up a fabric, he or she no doubt wrapped it around his or her hands -- the first gloves may have been the first garb of any kind. Glovers alone possess the special skill and required to alter and customize most common types of handwear, including gloves, mittens, and gauntlets.\
\
Not all clothing items will succumb to the scissors of a glover. Shirts, pants, dresses, gowns and the like require the more general skills of a tailor. Shoes, boots and footwear are the province of a cobbler, while hats and headwear are the speciality of the hatter. An experienced dyer is required to change the color of an item; and the application of custom symbols requires the services of an embroiderer. Glovers are encouraged to consider learning one or more of these skills as well."

"MATERIAL\
\
Glovers practice their noble craft upon two of the most fundamental qualities of headwear, material and fit.\
\
The MATERIAL of a handwear item defines its texture and feel, but it also says something about the skill of the maker and taste of the wearer. Over thirty different fabrics are available in Castle Marrach, some of great rarity or difficult to work. Novices may work in common materials such as burlap or linen, while more experienced glovers might produce items in exotic fabrics including silk, lizardskin or even spun glass!"

"FIT\
\
FIT describes the quality of the relationship between a handwear item and its wearer's hands. Novices must work hard to achieve even a \\"crude\\" or \\"awkward\\" fit; but after patient training, the serious student will be able to attain more desireable fits, including \\"flattering,\\" \\"tasteful\\" and \\"provocative\\"."

"MEASURES OF PROFICIENCY\
\
Various levels of proficiency are commonly recognized for the gloving skill:\
\
1. Novice\
2. Junior Apprentice\
3. Senior Apprentice\
4. Fellowcraft\
5. Journeyman\
6. Artisan\
7. Senior Artisan\
8. Master\
9. Master Adept\
10. Grand Master\
\
A Novice glover possesses very limited ability, and is able to attempt only a few rudimentary alterations. As skill increases, however, many more possibilities become available. A seasoned Master may command dozens of alteration options.\
\
The remainder of this hand-book describes the alteration options available to glovers at each level of proficiency."

"NOVICE\
\
Novices are the least experienced glovers. Their skills are admittedly rather limited and uninspiring.\
\
They can create items of burlap, homespun, and linen.\
\
The gloves they produce have a crude, awkward, or tasteless fit."

"JUNIOR APPRENTICE\
\
Junior Apprentices can manage a bit more than Novices, but their additional skill can hardly be called impressive.\
\
They work in canvas, cotton, and gauze.\
\
Their products' fit can be called careless, indifferent, or hurried."

"SENIOR APPRENTICE\
\
Senior Apprentices have attained sufficient skill to be create a handful of modest but useful styles.\
\
Gloves they produce can be made of hemp, muslin, or flannel.\
\
The fit of their gloves will be adequate, loose, or tight."

"FELLOWCRAFT\
\
Fellowcraft glovers have spent many hours learning their trade, and can apply a personal mark to items they produce.\
\
They work in leather, lawn, and brocade.\
\
Their gloves have a fit of trim, tasteful, or conservative."

"JOURNEYMAN\
\
Journeymen glovers possess the confidence to produce work with significant appeal.\
\
They work in suede, velveteen, and fur.\
\
Gloves they create might be attractive, modest, and revealing."

"ARTISAN\
\
Artisans have proven themselves capable of the fine control needed to handle some of the more challenging fabrics and styles.\
\
Materials such as calfskin, satin, and lace can be employed by these glovers.\
\
Their work has a fit best described as either classical, provocative, or flattering."

"SENIOR ARTISAN\
\
Senior Artisans are sought by those desiring rare fabrics and fine cuts for their handwear. They often serve as assistants to Master glovers.\
\
These craftsmen work in serge, damask, and velour.\
\
The fit of their gloves is either elegant, cunning, or stylish."

"MASTER\
\
Masters are much in demand. They work with materials and styles of the most rarified quality. They can also alter the Material and Fit of handwear items that have already been altered.\
\
The materials they might employ include lambskin, lizardskin, and silverweave.\
\
Their gloves have a fit of exquisite, graceful, or beautiful."

"MASTER ADEPT\
\
Master Adepts are the expert glovers of the castle, capable of using particularly splendid fabrics and finishes. Most of their efforts are for the benefit of the aristocracy and the court.\
\
They often work in silk, velvet, or goldweave.\
\
Their gloves have a fit of perfect, immaculate, or sublime."

"GRAND MASTER\
\
Often, long seasons go by without a Grand Master of the gloving craft appearing in the castle. Their skills are employed almost exclusively for royalty.\
\
The fantastic materials of iridescent, diaphanous, and glassweave are only used by these glovers.\
\
They can produce gloves which have a divine fit."

"UPDATES\
\
As fashions change, new materials become available, and the craft lore increases, more options will be available to the castle's glovers. The text of this book will mysteriously update itself as new choices become available. More skilled glovers will inform you if and when updates occur.\
\
Please bring typographical errors or other textual problems found in this volume to the attention of the staff."
